means: 可理解的，明白易懂的，清楚的

sentence.Network_en: The language of Darwin was intelligible to experts and non-experts alike.
sentence.Network_cn: 达尔文的语言无论对专家还是非专业人士而言都明白易懂。

sentence.Network_en: His lecture was readily intelligible to all the students.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的讲课学生们都能轻松地听懂。

sentence.Network_en: This report would be intelligible only to an expert in computing.
sentence.Network_cn: 只有计算机运算专家才能看懂这份报告.

...ewson)把概念的可理解性、合理性和有效性称为概念的状态(conceptual status)， 即可理解的(intelligible)、可相信的(plausible)及可广泛应用的(fruitful)等三个状态。K学习者对于概念所处的.

于2011年10月24日逝世，享年84周岁。人工智能1949年在数学系作时，他决定尝试在机器上模拟人的智能，1955年他联合（创立者）、（大师，《心智社会》的作者）、（计算机设计者之一），发起了达特茅斯项目（Dartmouth Project），第二年正式启动，提供了极有限的资助。现在看来，这个项目不但是发展史的一个重要事件，也是计算机科学的一个里程碑，正是在1956年，麦卡锡首次提出“人工智能”（artificial intelligence）这一概念，现在看来，那次讨论并没有实质上解决有关智能机的任何

托福词汇表_百度文库 ... hormone 荷尔蒙 intelligence 智慧 emotion 情感.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (also in the sense 'capable of understanding'): from Latin intelligibilis, from intelligere 'understand' (see intelligent)

entry.def: Something that is intelligible can be understood.

example.ex: The language of Darwin was intelligible to experts and non-experts alike...
example.tran: 达尔文的语言无论对专家还是非专业人士而言都明白易懂。

example.ex: The woman moaned faintly but made no intelligible response.
example.tran: 那个女人发出微弱的呻吟声，却没有作出任何有意义的反应。

means.word_mean: 1. capable of being apprehended or understood
2. well articulated or enunciated, and loud enough to be heard distinctly;

auth_sentence.content: Plato supposeth the Universe...a living intelligible creature.
auth_sentence.res_content: Plato supposeth the Universe...a living intelligible creature.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Plato supposeth the Universe...a living intelligible creature.

auth_sentence.content: Yet now that same audio is intelligible and of listenable quality.
auth_sentence.res_content: Yet now that same audio is intelligible and of listenable quality.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yet now that same audio is intelligible and of listenable quality.

auth_sentence.content: Whence came the notion that we can depend on an intelligible order.
auth_sentence.res_content: Whence came the notion that we can depend on an intelligible order.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Whence came the notion that we can depend on an intelligible order.

means.word_mean: 可理解的, 明白易懂的, 清楚的

sentences.en: He gave us an intelligible explanation.
sentences.cn: 他给了我们一个明白易懂的解释。

sentences.en: This report would be intelligible only to an expert in computing.
sentences.cn: 只有计算机运算专家才能看懂这份报告。

jushi.english: He gave us an intelligible explanation.
jushi.chinese: 他给我们一个明白易懂的解释。

jushi.chinese: 只有计算机领域的专家才能看懂这份报告。
